publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1060 Mr Brian Monteith: 1st Anniversary of Cuban Political Arrests-That the Parliament notes that on 18 March 2003 the Government of the Republic of Cuba arrested more than 75 journalists, labour union organisers, civic leaders and human rights activists who were sentenced to a total of more than 1,000 years in prison; notes that these prisoners have been recognised by Amnesty International as "prisoners of conscience" while Reporters Without Borders has called Cuba the "world's biggest prison for journalists"; calls upon the Cuban Government of Fidel Castro to release its political prisoners, allow the assembly of independent parties that may participate in open elections and follow the example of the Republic of China by recognising the right to hold property, and calls upon the United States of America to remove unilaterally its trade embargo with the Republic of Cuba so that it may join the international community of the free world.
S2M-1060 1st Anniversary of Cuban Political Arrests (lodged on 17 March 2004) Mr David Davidson*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Alex Johnstone*, Phil Gallie*, Bill Aitken*
